job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Auburn, CA
pros: Great team and support Lot of ways to gain experience Flexible hours
cons: Low staff at times meant taking on more responsibility that was a at times too much for one person and at the detriment of the residents. I.e. paperwork or notes not getting finished in a timely manner; no one to review the MAR to catch errors

review_title: Good for experience getting your foot in the door
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Woodland, CA
pros: Helping people in need, Flexible schedule, learning to be a problem solver
cons: Bad management, dangerous to some if not supervised, low pay, bad benefits

job_title: BHT-behavioral Health Tech in Roseville, CA
cons: low pay, not enough staff members

job_title: Mental Health Worker in Woodland, CA
pros: excellent atmosphere. Management seems to actually care about both staff and clients. It was a great place to learn and gain skills, (and many employees are current students or recent gradsor working on grad school in MH ).
cons: The pay was quite low. Around 50 cents an hour over minimum wage. Most people worked a rotating schedule which is hard on sleep patterns
